result.execSummary:
The defendant Alicia Ann Remley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
In the event of non-payment of outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

The drug buy money reimbursement is to be joint and several with the co-defendant's in case numbers 14CF86 and 14CF88.

Court grants good time. Huber release is granted for all purposes. 
May be served in a bordering county if at no cost to Barron County.
Must submit DNA sample and pay the surcharge.

Defendant Alicia Ann Remley in court with attorney Richard Louis Yonko.  Defendant Alicia Ann Remley in custody.  Russell Edward Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State makes corrections to PSI. State makes recommendation. Defense makes recommendation. Defendant makes statement. 

Court relates and orders: 
1 yr jail with Good Time. Huber release granted for all purposes.
Jail may be served at a border county if at no cost to Barron County.
39 days jail credit. 
Court costs including the $220 in buy money which will be joint and several with the co-defendants Heather M. (14CF86) and Derek G. (14CF88).
Provide DNA sample and surcharge.
